# Roleplay Rule 11 – Follow Reasonable Escalation
Prospect Sector is a **cooperative progression game**, not a PvP environment. Conflicts may happen through RP, but escalation must always be **proportional, justified, and controlled**.
All conflicts should begin at the **lowest appropriate level** and escalate only if the other party escalates first. You may match their level of escalation, but you should not jump ahead without cause.
Escalation steps: - Verbal - Non-harmful - Non-lethal - Lethal - Permanently lethal (almost never justified)
Players who genuinely attempt to de-escalate will be given more leniency. Someone observing you over multiple rounds should not feel like your character constantly seeks escalation.
## Additional Guidelines - Indirect escalation (such as stealing an ID that traps someone) counts as escalation. - Conflicts rarely justify lethal force, and **almost never** justify permanently lethal actions. - If someone enters crit or dies, you should take them for medical care unless there is clear IC justification not to. Doing so de-escalates the conflict. - You may not escalate based on unreasonable assumptions or flimsy justification. - Hostile mobs, dangerous anomalies, and similar non-player threats are exempt—but **you** are still responsible if you break rules attacking them or using them as tools.
## MRP Amendment Escalation rules apply even when the opposing entity is a non-player, unless clearly designated by admins.
## Examples of Conflict Types See [textlink="Examples of Conflict Types" link="RuleR11-2"].
## Escalation Involving Animals See [textlink="Escalation Involving Animals" link="RuleR11-1"].
## Example Scenarios These examples assume normal cooperative gameplay.
### Acceptable: - Someone punches you; you punch back until they stop, then bring them to medbay. - A clown pies you and steals your shoes; you slip them and take their mask in return. - You use a non-lethal tool to stop someone fleeing during an RP confrontation. - You stop an unauthorized person from entering a hazardous area through reasonable force. - Two players escalate a dispute over time into a fistfight through proper escalation. - Destroying a body only when an examine message indicates recovery is impossible.
### Prohibited: - Someone punches you once; you gib them. - Responding to a prank or annoyance (pie, shove, insult) with stabbing or lethal force. - Using lethal weapons to stop someone fleeing a conversation. - Attacking someone for entering a low-risk area without escalation. - Harassing a department repeatedly (breaking glasses, furniture, tools). - Escalating based on bad assumptions (thinking someone is trespassing when they aren’t). - Hiding or spacing bodies over minor disputes. - Stealing IDs from disconnected players. - Immediately restarting a lethal conflict after the other party brought you to medbay.
